summary: The contact owns 2007 Cadillac Escalade. The contact stated while driving approximately 70 MPH, she struck an elk head on. The contact was able to safely pull over to the side of the road. The vehicle suffered damage to the front end, the hood. Additionally the transmission pan was cracked. The contact stated the airbags did not deploy. The contact had the vehicle towed to a collision repair shop. The contact stated after the repairs the check airbag light would blink and later remained illuminated. The contact took the vehicle to a local dealer where it was diagnosed that both airbags needed to be replaced. The vehicle was not repaired. The manufacturer had been informed of the failure. The failure mileage was approximately 150,000.

Loss of all electical power to vehicle as though battery failure. Dashboard goes out at times and I am unable to see how fast I am going or if the car is even in drive.  Service Stabilitrack light comes on, but goes away.  While driving my car door locks. They would lock, unlock. DVD/Nav and Radio shuts off.Air bag light comes on. Driver seat was not working , took it to a mechanic and it read bad motor for seat. About a week ago, the seat started to work again, which worried me. Our mechanic was also worried because he believes it’s an electrical problems which may be very dangerous on the road. The smell of a plastic like fume lingers sometimes.

The airbag system failed and was reported the first time in 2020 and it was available for inspection upon request by owner but Cadillac said it wasn't a recall and refused to comply.  My safety and the other passenger was put at risk because Cadillac didn't  inspect the the fail system upon the owner's upon the owner's first request that caused serious injuries and the vehicle has been in another incident.  The airbag system has not been fixed, body,  and light damages to be reproducted or confirmes by a dealer or independent service center for my case 9-7027849113.  The vehicle has not been inspected by manufacturer, police, insurance representative, or others. There wasn't any warning lamps, or other symptoms prior to the failure and they first appeared in the last incident on April 23, 2021.

The contact owns a 2007 Cadillac Escalade. The contact stated while driving at 15 MPH, smoke coming from the interior of the dashboard. The contact pulled the vehicle over to the side of the road and disconnected the battery from the vehicle and opened the dashboard and saw wiring in the harness of the dashboard melting. The contact put water on the dashboard to stop the smoke. The contact had someone help push their vehicle to their residence. The vehicle was not diagnosed or repaired. The manufacturer was made aware of the failure. The failure mileage was approximately 150,000.

MY FAMILY RECENTLY PURCHASED 4 NEW TIRES MICHELIN ENERGY SAVER A/S 265/65/18. THE TIRES WERE PURCHASED IN NOVEMBER. WITH THE TIRES BEING UNDER 6 MONTHS OLD WE HAVE ALREADY EXPERIENCED THE FOLLOWING ISSUES. 4 SEPARATE FLAT TIRES. WHICH I GAVE MICHELIN THE BENEFIT OF THE DOUBT THAT ITS NOT COMPLETELY THERE FAULT FOR NAILS / SCREWS BEING IN ROADWAYS. BUT COMMON 4 FLATS IN A MATTER OF A FEW MONTHS WITH ONLY 4K MILES BEING PUT ON THE VEHICLE SINCE TIRES INSTALLED. FINALLY WHAT COMPLETELY GOT ME WAS THE SIDE WALL DEVELOPED A 3 INCH SPLIT. IM JUST GLAD I NOTICED IT BEFORE MY WIFE AND KIDS WERE DRIVING THE VEHICLE DOWN THE HIGHWAY AND HAD A BLOWOUT ON THE STEER TIRES. AFTER LOOKING AT REVIEWS ONLINE IM NOT THE ONLY PERSON THAT HAVING ISSUE WITH THESE TIRES. THERE ARE MULTIPLE COMPLAINTS ABOUT SIDEWALL BLOWOUTS AND THESE TIRES BEING MAGNETS FOR SCREWS AND NAILS. ALSO MANY REVIEWS ABOUT PREMATURE DRY ROT. (I CANT WAIT FOR THEM TO DEVELOP THIS ISSUE AS ITS MORE THAN LIKELY COMING). TERRIBLE TIRES. DONT RECOMMEND THESE FOR ANYONE. I DONT WANT TO SEE ANYONE HURT OR INJURED DUE TO THIS POORLY ENGINEERED TIRE.

2007 CADILLAC ESCALADE APPARENTLY WAS BUILT WITH SEVERE CAMSHAFT AND BEARING ISSUE.  1ST. STABILITRAK, TRACTION CONTROL LIGHT AND WARNING.  STRAIGHT AND LEVEL DRIVING ON CLEAR DRY DAY.  THIS IS WHEN ENGINE WAS RUNNING ON HIGHWAY AND ENGINE FULLY AT OPERATING TEMPERATURE.  THIS FORCED TRANSMISSION/ENGINE INTO LIMP MODE.  MCCADDON DEALERSHIP INSTALLED COMPLETE TRANSMISSION COST OVER $8,000----  ISSUE CAME BACK.  THEN THEY REPLACED FUEL PUMP.  THEN THEY REPLACED OIL PUMP WHICH SEEMED TO FIX ISSUE, COST $2084.04. IT JUST FREELY SPUN AROUND AND AROUND. THANKFULLY, I WAS ABLE TO STOP THE VEHICLE BEFORE HITTING A TREE AND MY KIDS AND I WERE NOT INJURED, JUST VERY SHAKEN. HOWEVER, IT WAS AND STILL IS VERY PRESENT IN MY MIND WHAT THE OUTCOME COULD HAVE BEEN HAD WE BEEN ON THE HIGHWAY OR GOING AT A FASTER SPEED.   CADILLAC ROADSIDE WAS VERY HELPFUL IN GETTING THE CAR TOWED TO THE DEALERSHIP WHERE WE PURCHASED THE VEHICLE AND HAVE HAD ALL MAINTENANCE DONE IN THE PAST. AFTER REVIEW OF THE VEHICLE I WAS TOLD THAT THEY ARE REALLY NOT SURE WHAT WENT WRONG, AS THEY HAD NEVER SEEN ANYTHING LIKE IT. APPARENTLY THE WHOLE FRONT STEERING SYSTEM IS SUPPOSED TO COLLAPSE IN A HEAD ON COLLISION, BUT FOR SOME REASON IT COLLAPSED WITHOUT WARNING OR REASON. CONSEQUENTLY, DUE TO THE STEERING WHEEL CONTINUOUSLY SPINNING, IT HAD RIPPED OUT ALL THE POWER CORDS TO THE RADIO, AIR CONDITIONING, POWER STEERING, STABILITRAC, ETC. THE CAR WAS A DISASTER AND AT THAT POINT I HAD NO TRUST IN THE CAR TO EVER DRIVE IT AGAIN.   I HAD ENJOYED MY VEHICLE UP TO THIS POINT, BUT THIS HAS MADE ME INCREDIBLY CONCERNED ABOUT PUTTING MY FAMILY IN ANOTHER CADILLAC VEHICLE.  *TR

IN NOV. 2010 THE FRONT SEAT HEATERS FAILED IN OUR CADILLAC ESCALADE ESV.  AT THAT TIME AN ELECTRICAL BURNING SMELL WAS OBSERVED BY THE OCCUPANTS. A LATER INSPECTION FOUND THAT THE "J1" WIRING CONNECTOR, WHICH CONNECTS TO THE SEAT CLIMATE CONTROL MODULE, WHICH IS INADEQUATE FOR THE CURRENT LOAD,  HAD OVERHEATED RESULTING IN THE WHITE PLASTIC CONNECTOR  BECOMING BLACKENED AND BRITTLE,. THIS RESULTED IN THE A LOSS OF POWER TO THE SEAT HEATER.  AS THE VEHICLE IS SOME 6 MONTHS AND SOME 10,000 MILES OUT OF WARRANTY, THE CADILLAC DEALER RECOMMENDED THE REPLACEMENT OF THE J1 CONNECTOR, REPAIR THE WIRING, AND REPLACEMENT OF THE SEAT CLIMATE CONTROL MODULE AT AN ESTIMATED COST OF $550.00  AFTER CONTACTING CADILLAC CUSTOMER SERVICE, A CADILLAC DISTRICT REPRESENTATIVE CONTACTED ME AND WORKING WITH THE DEALERSHIP HAS OFFERED TO PERFORM THE RECOMMENDED REPAIR FOR A $200.00 DEDUCTIBLE.   WHEN I ASKED THAT A LETTER STATING THE TERMS OF THEIR OFFER BE SENT TO ME, CADILLACS DISTRICT REPRESENTATIVE STATED SHE CANNOT PUT ANYTHING IN WRITING.  *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CADILLAC ESCALADE.  WHEN IT RAINED, WATER WOULD LEAK AROUND THE SUNROOF.  THE WATER LEAKED INTO THE SIDE CURTAIN AIR BAG.  THE DEALER STATED THAT THE DRAIN HOSE WAS NOT ORIGINALLY INSTALLED; THEREFORE, THEY INSTALLED THE DRAIN HOSE AND REPLACED THE SIDE CURTAIN AIR BAG.  WHILE DRIVING 50 MPH, THE VEHICLE DOWNSHIFTED INTO SECOND GEAR AND BEGAN TO SPIN.  THE CHECK ENGINE LIGHT ILLUMINATED.  AFTER IT FINISHED SPINNING, THE VEHICLE STOPPED.  THE CONTACT COULD NOT ACCELERATE PAST 30 MPH WHILE DRIVING HOME.  THE DEALER STATED THAT THE RANGE SWITCH IN THE TRANSMISSION FAILED, BUT THE CAUSE OF THE FAILURE WAS UNKNOWN.  THE DEALER REPLACED THE RANGE SWITCH.  WHILE DRIVING 25 MPH, THE VEHICLE SURGED FORWARD.  THE BRAKE PEDAL WAS DEPRESSED; HOWEVER, THE VEHICLE WOULD NOT SLOW DOWN FOR 3-4 SECONDS.  THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED FOR THE FAILURE.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 3,000 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 27,850.  UPDATED 4/2/08 *CN  UPDATED 04/02/08  *TR
